arm_group.description: Continuous irrigation of the bladder with warm saline (up to 45 Celsius) using the PelvixTT system

brief_summary.textblock:
Patients with Interstitial Cystitis / PBS will be treated with bladder thermal distention
      (BTD).

clinical_study.brief_title: Bladder Thermal Distention for Patients With Interstitial Cystitis / Painful Bladder Syndrome

detailed_description.textblock:
In this study we will evaluate the efficacy of bladder thermal distention (BTD) in patients
      with IC/PBS.

      Patients with previous failed conventional treatment (intravesical DMSO) will be recruited.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        -All patients with interstitial cystitis / painful bladder syndrome (IC/PBS) who had
        previous intravesical treatment with DMSO

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Active infection

          -  Urethral stricture

intervention.description: Bladder Thermal Distention (BTD) is an approved procedure in Europe and Israel. Continuous irrigation of the bladder with warm saline with the PelvixTT system. The procedure will be performed on an outpatients basis. The procedure lasts 1 hour.

clinical_study.official_title: Bladder Thermal Distention for Patients With Interstitial Cystitis / Painful Bladder Syndrome

primary_outcome.description: o'leary sant questionnaire is a validated specific tool for evaluation of IC/PBS symptoms

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: symptoms like urgency. frequency and functional voided volumes will be monitored

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
